title: problem compiling this code

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust trait MyIterTools { type Element; fn split(self, splitter: Splitter) -> SplitIterator where Splitter: Fn(&Self::Item) -> bool, Self: Iterator + Sized; } impl MyIterTools for dyn Iterator { type Element = T; fn split(self, splitter: Splitter) -> SplitIterator where Splitter: Fn(&T) -> bool, Self: Iterator + Sized, { SplitIterator::new(self, splitter) } } pub struct SplitIterator where It: Iterator, Splitter: Fn(&T) -> bool, { inner: It, splitter: Splitter, } impl SplitIterator where It: Iterator, Splitter: Fn(&T) -> bool, { pub fn new(inner: It, splitter: Splitter) -> Self where It: Iterator + Sized, Splitter: Fn(&T) -> bool + Sized, { Self { inner, splitter } } } impl Iterator for SplitIterator where It: Iterator, Splitter: Fn(&T) -> bool, { type Item = Vec; fn next(&mut self) -> Option { let mut result = None; while let Some(item) = self.inner.next() { if !(self.splitter)(&item) { result.get_or_insert_with(Vec::new).push(item); } else { break; } } result } } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.65.0 (897e37553 2022-11-02) binary: rustc commit-hash: 897e37553bba8b42751c67658967889d11ecd120 commit-date: 2022-11-02 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.65.0 LLVM version: 15.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` bugged on  master [?] is 📦 v0.1.0 via 🦀 v1.65.0 ❯ cargo build Compiling bugged v0.1.0 (/home/alban/dev/perso/bugged) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'cannot copy unsized immediates', /rustc/897e37553bba8b42751c67658967889d11ecd120/compiler/rustc_const_eval/src/interpret/place.rs:643:17 backtrace... (see further) error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.65.0 (897e37553 2022-11-02) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: --crate-type lib -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental=[REDACTED] note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [mir_drops_elaborated_and_const_checked] elaborating drops for `::split` #1 [optimized_mir] optimizing MIR for `::split` end of query stack error: could not compile `bugged` ```
Backtrace
